title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.71 - Executive Order No. 71: Further Extending the Period for Paying Real Property Taxes Without Interest in Clinton County due to a Disaster Emergency. [*]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.71 - Executive Order No. 71: Further Extending the Period for Paying Real Property Taxes Without Interest in Clinton County due to a Disaster Emergency. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on January 7, 1998, a severe storm
system with a combination of rain, freezing rain, and ice caused widespread
power outages and disrupted vital transportation and public safety systems in
the counties and the contiguous areas of Clinton, Essex, Franklin, Jefferson, St. Lawrence and Lewis; WHEREAS, this event resulted in personal hardship and
damage to residential and commercial property, and it continues to pose a
threat to the public health and safety; WHEREAS, by Executive Order Number 60.1, I declared a State

Disaster Emergency in the affected counties, and directed State agencies to
respond as necessary to assist those affected counties in restoring vital
public transportation systems and to provide such other assistance as necessary
to protect the public health and safety; WHEREAS, real property taxes for the 1998 fiscal year are
currently due in the affected counties; WHEREAS, by virtue of section
924
of
the Real Property Tax Law, such taxes would normally be payable without
interest only through January 31, 1998; WHEREAS, January 31, 1998 being a Saturday, by virtue of
section
925-a
(1)
of the Real Property Tax Law, the period
for paying such taxes without interest was automatically extended until the
next business day, which was February 2, 1998; WHEREAS, such taxes would normally be subject to interest
if paid after that date; WHEREAS, section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, as added by

Chapter 389 of the Laws of 1997, authorizes the Governor to issue an Executive

Order during a State Disaster Emergency, extending the period for paying real
property taxes without interest by up to seven days in a county, city, town, village or school district in the affected area, if the Chief Executive Office
of the county, city, town, village, or school district requests such an
extension; WHEREAS, a request for such an extension was received on
behalf of Clinton County; WHEREAS, given the hardships facing the people of Clinton

County as a result of the ice storm, such an extension was warranted; WHEREAS, pursuant to section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, by

Executive Order Number 65, I extended by seven days the period for paying
without interest the real property taxes that are currently due in Clinton

County, so that such taxes could be payable without interest through February
9, 1998; WHEREAS, a request for a further extension pursuant to
section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law has been
received on behalf of Clinton County; and
WHEREAS, the residents of Clinton County continue to face
personal hardship as a result of the storm; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, pursuant to section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, do hereby
further extend by seven days the period for paying without interest the real
property taxes that are currently due in Clinton County, so that such taxes
shall be payable without interest through February 16, 1998; and
FURTHER, by virtue of the same section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, any taxes
not paid by such date shall be subject to the same penalties and interest that
would have applied if no such extension had been granted. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: February 6, 1998
